revised_title: The Influence of Gases on Electron Emission from Hot Metals
tldr: The author investigates how gases affect the emission of electrons and ions from hot metals. They find that the constants representing electron currents are influenced by the nature and pressure of the surrounding gas. A linear relationship exists between these constants and the gas pressure, which applies to both electron and ion emissions. This research provides a better understanding of the behavior of metals in various gaseous environments.
